frame.name: Medical_instruments
frame.definition:
<def-root>This frame includes words for medical instruments--i.e. <fen>Instrument</fen>s designed for an institutional function or <fen>Purpose</fen>.
<ex><gov>Use</gov> <x>the<fex name="Inst"><t>stethoscope</t></fex></x> <fex name="Purpose">to check his lungs</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Purpose</fen> for which an <fen>Instrument</fen> is used.
<ex>Use the <t>stethoscope</t> <fex name="Purpose">to check his lungs</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Instrument
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the medical <fen>Instrument</fen>. <ex>Use the <fex name="Inst"><t>stethoscope</t></fex> to check his lungs.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: stethoscope.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a medical instrument for listening to the action of someone's heart or breathing, having a small disc-shaped resonator that is placed against the chest and two tubes connected to earpieces

lexUnit.name: bronchoscope.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a slender tubular instrument with a small light at the end for the inspection of the bronchi

lexUnit.name: colonoscope.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a long flexible endoscope, often equipped with a device for obtaining tissue samples, that is used for visual examination of the colon

lexUnit.name: endoscope.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a medical instrument which can be introduced into the body to view its internal parts

lexUnit.name: catheter.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a flexible tube inserted through a narrow opening into a body cavity, particularly the bladder, for removing fluid

lexUnit.name: forceps.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a pair of pincers used in surgery or in a laboratory

lexUnit.name: cholecystoscope.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a medical instrument used for the examination of the gall bladder

lexUnit.name: fluoroscope.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an instrument with a fluorescent screen used for viewing X-ray images without taking and developing X-ray photographs

lexUnit.name: gastroscope.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an optical instrument used for inspecting the interior of the stomach

lexUnit.name: laparoscope.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a slender, tubular endoscope that is inserted through an incision in the abdominal wall to examine or perform minor surgery within the abdominal or pelvic cavities

lexUnit.name: ophthalmoscope.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an instrument for inspecting the retina and other parts of the eye

lexUnit.name: oscilloscope.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a device for viewing oscillations by a display on the screen of a cathode ray tube

lexUnit.name: sigmoidoscope.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a tubular instrument for visual examination of the sigmoid flexure

lexUnit.name: needle.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the pointed hollow end of a hypodermic syringe

lexUnit.name: scalpel.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a knife with a small sharp blade, as used by a surgeon

lexUnit.name: speculum.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a metal instrument that is used to dilate an orifice or canal in the body to allow inspection

lexUnit.name: syringe.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a tube with a nozzle and piston or bulb for sucking in and ejecting liquid in a thin stream, often one fitted with a hollow needle for injecting or withdrawing fluids into or from the body

lexUnit.name: otoscope.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an instrument for examining the interior of the ear, especially the ear drum,, consisting essentially of a magnifying lens and a light

lexUnit.name: blood pressure cuff.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an inflatable band that is wrapped around an extremity to control the flow of blood through the part when recording blood pressure with a sphygmomanometer
